name: Enable Automatic Failover for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis clusters have automatic failover enabled to improve availability and fault tolerance. This feature automatically promotes a read replica to primary if the primary node fails.

name: Use Private Subnets for ElastiCache Clusters
description: Deploy ElastiCache clusters in private subnets within a VPC to prevent direct internet access. This aligns with the principle of using only private resources unless explicitly required otherwise.

name: Enable Automatic Backups for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis clusters have automatic backups enabled. This allows point-in-time recovery and helps protect against data loss.

name: Enable Multi-AZ for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Enable Multi-AZ for ElastiCache Redis clusters to improve availability and fault tolerance. This feature automatically replicates data across multiple Availability Zones.

name: Enable In-Transit Encryption for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis clusters have in-transit encryption enabled using TLS. This protects data as it moves between the cache and application servers.

name: Enable At-Rest Encryption for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis clusters have at-rest encryption enabled using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMKs). This protects data stored in the cache.

name: Enable Redis AUTH for Older ElastiCache Redis Replication Groups
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis replication groups of earlier versions have Redis AUTH enabled. This provides an additional layer of authentication for accessing the Redis server.

name: Enable Automatic Minor Version Upgrades for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis clusters have automatic minor version upgrades enabled. This ensures that clusters receive the latest minor version updates, which often include bug fixes and security patches.

name: Use Custom Subnet Groups for ElastiCache Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache clusters use custom subnet groups instead of the default subnet group. This allows for better control over network placement and isolation of the cache clusters.

name: Enable Auth Token for ElastiCache Redis Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache Redis clusters have an auth token enabled. This provides an additional layer of security by requiring a token for client authentication.

name: Use VPC Security Groups for ElastiCache Clusters
description: Ensure ElastiCache clusters use VPC security groups for network access control instead of the deprecated ElastiCache security groups. This provides more granular control over inbound and outbound traffic to the cache clusters.

name: Implement Least Privilege Access for ElastiCache Clusters
description: Ensure that IAM policies follow the principle of least privilege, granting only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for managing and accessing ElastiCache clusters.

name: Enable ElastiCache Cluster Monitoring
description: Ensure that Amazon CloudWatch monitoring is enabled for ElastiCache clusters to track performance metrics, set alarms, and respond to operational issues promptly.

name: Use Latest ElastiCache Engine Version
description: Ensure ElastiCache clusters are using the latest stable engine version to benefit from the most recent security patches, bug fixes, and performance improvements.

name: Implement Regular Maintenance Windows for ElastiCache Clusters
description: Configure regular maintenance windows for ElastiCache clusters to ensure that system updates and patches are applied in a timely manner without disrupting critical operations.
